page.title: 14HOW YALDING GETS THE NEWS
page.content: There is hardly a house which does not receive radio and television trans- missions, both local and national. Local radio, Radio Kent, is widely used. Most houses buy a national daily newspaper. Local weekly papers are "The Kent & Sussex Courier" and the "Kent Messenger", which has a local news reporter in Yalding. Free weekly newspapers are "Maidstone Borough News" and "Adscene". Yalding has an excellent parish magazine which, sponsored by the Church, prints news reports from all village organisa- tions. Each month 800 copies are printed and are distributed to every house in Yalding and nearby Ladding- ford. Entertainment includes occasional evening discos at Yalding School. Visiting hop-pickers live in small hoppers' huts.
